attributes.action: require pharmaceutical companies that sell drugs in the UK to devote a certain amount of R&D expenditure to diseases of the poor
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Following on from recent news (February 2009) that GlaxoSmithKline, amongst others, will reduce the prices of drugs to third world countries, and share their patent pool; we, the undersigned, would request that HM Government investigate ways in that any pharmacuetical company selling pharmaceutical drugs in the UK are obliged to devote a certain amount of their R&D expenditure towards tackling the diseases that affect Third World countries, rather than leaving this important task to charitable organisations such as the Bill and Melissa Foundation.
